1604065972_mirrored_jarodlee_github.body:
This issue is still present.

ZeroNet version:
[12:18:58] - Version: 0.7.0 r4080, Python 3.7.3 (default, Apr  3 2019, 05:39:12) 

Browser:
NetSurf 3.6 (19th November 2016)

Relevant log entry:
[12:16:54] Ui.UiServer Error 403: Invalid Accept header to load wrapper

It works on Firefox 66.0.3 (64-bit). Same machine.
Just did a git pull of NetSurf (NetSurf 3.9 (Dev))  same error.

1604067086_mirrored_styromaniac_github.body: Hidden sites on Tor ignore port restrictions, as far as I've experienced :)

1604067082_mirrored_duckartes_github.body:
> I don't know much about Tor and Tor Browser.
> 
> Could this help you tho https://zeronet.io/docs/faq/#how-to-use-zeronet-with-the-tor-browser ?

Does not work, as this disables connecting through Tor, thus no .onion.

I tried disabling all restrictions and allowing the onion but it didn't work. 

I have a hidden site I can connect to if I proxy through Tor in Firefox, but Tor Browser does not allow it. 

Clarification: I can connect to the hidden site in Tor Browser, but the interface does not fully load. I'm assuming this is a protection layer built in disabling certain code. 

:man_shrugging:

topic.title: How do you configure Tor Browser to work with a remote ZeroNet server?
topic.body:
In the past I just used a proxy switcher on Firefox and connected through Tor, but now I'm trying to use Tor Browser I only get the ZeroNet logo in the top right corner when connecting to my Tor address through Tor Browser. 

Can't seem to figure out what to disable to allow access to it. 

Also what's the best way going about setting up HTTPS?
